summary: Mustelidae is a large family of meat-eating mammals, often called mustelids. They include weasels, badgers, otters, and wolverines. There are around 66 to 70 different species, making it the biggest family in the Caniformia group of carnivores. These animals are related and share some similar features, but they have adapted to live in various habitats, from rivers to forests.
title: Mustelidae
